element.name: axis
element.description: Describes a range axis to use in a <multiAxisChart>. Each axis has its own range indicator and a data plot.
element.contains: ( barChart | bar3DChart | xyBarChart | stackedBarChart | stackedBar3DChart | lineChart | xyLineChart | areaChart | xyAreaChart | scatterChart | bubbleChart | timeSeriesChart | highLowChart | candlestickChart | stackedBarChart )

attribute.name: position
attribute.description: Where relative to the chart to display the range axis for this chart

value.name: leftOrTop
value.description: Display the axis to the left (for charts with a Vertical orientation) or top (for charts with a Horizontal orientation.)

value.name: rightOrBottom
value.description: Display the axis to the right (for charts with a Vertical orientation) or bottom (for charts with a Horizontal orientation.)

attribute.name: labelColor
attribute.description: The color to use for the caption of the axis.

attribute.name: tickLabelColor
attribute.description: The color to use for the label of each tick mark on the axis.

attribute.name: tickLabelMask
attribute.description: A formatting mask to use for the label of each tick mark on the axis. Only used if the axis is time based or numeric based. For numeric axes the format of the mask is described in documentation for java.text.DecimalFormat. For a date axis the format used is described in java.text.SimpleDateFormat. Finally, for date axes the values "SHORT", "MEDIUM", "LONG" and "FULL" can be used as described in java.text.DateFormat.

attribute.name: lineColor
attribute.description: The color to use when drawing the line showing the axis.

element.name: background
element.description: Definition of the page background section for this report. The background section is displayed on every page and cannot overflow to the next page. Elements placed on this section are evaluated at page initialization time and are displayed in the back. All other page elements are displayed on top of the background elements. This section allows creating watermark or other similar effects in documents.

element.name: band
element.description: Generic definition of a report section.
element.contains: ( printWhenExpression?, ( break | line | rectangle | ellipse | image | staticText | textField | subreport | pieChart | pie3DChart | barChart | bar3DChart | xyBarChart | stackedBarChart | stackedBar3DChart | lineChart | xyLineChart | areaChart | xyAreaChart | scatterChart | bubbleChart | timeSeriesChart | highLowChart | candlestickChart | meterChart | thermometerChart | multiAxisChart | stackedAreaChart | elementGroup | crosstab | frame )*)

value.name: true

value.name: false
value.description: When the band stretches and it does not fit on the current page, the content of the band will be transferred on the next new page. On this new page the flag will be ignored since the band has to be displayed even there is not enough space to acquire the stretch.

There are some restrictions/rules regarding crosstab cells:

Cells cannot split on multiple pages.

attribute.description:
Crosstab cell background color.
The cell is filled with the background color only if the cell has opaque mode.

Name of the report level style to use (see <style> element).
The style is only used for cell background and borders and is not inherited by elements inside the cell.

element.name: chart
element.description: Defines a chart report element
element.contains: ( reportElement, box?, chartTitle?, chartSubtitle?, chartLegend? anchorNameExpression?, hyperlinkReferenceExpression?, hyperlinkAnchorExpression?, hyperlinkPageExpression?, hyperlinkTooltipExpression?, hyperlinkParameter* )

attribute.name: isShowLegend
attribute.description: Show legend flag

attribute.name: evaluationTime
attribute.description: The chart can be rendered at a specified moment. This could be useful, for example, when we want to have on the first page a chart that will be generated only after fetching all the data source rows.

value.name: Now
value.description: The chart is rendered when filling the current band (section).

value.name: Report
value.description: The chart is rendered when reaching the end of the report.

value.name: Page
value.description: The chart is rendered when reaching the end of the current page.

value.name: Column
value.description: The chart is rendered when reaching the end of the current column.

value.name: Group
value.description: The chart is rendered when the group specified by the evaluationGroup attribute changes.

value.name: Band
value.description: The chart is rendered after the parent band has finished rendering all the other elements.

attribute.name: evaluationGroup
attribute.description: Used to specify the group at which to render the chart, when evaluationTime is "Group".

attribute.name: hyperlinkType
attribute.description:
Indicates the type of the hyperlink element.
The type can be:
One of the built-in types:
None The current element doesn't represent a hyperlink. Reference The current hyperlink points to an external resource specified by the corresponding <hyperlinkReferenceExpression> element, usually an URL. LocalAnchor The current hyperlink points to a local anchor specified by the corresponding <hyperlinkAnchorExpression> element. LocalPage The current hyperlink points to a 1 based page index within the current document specified by the corresponding <hyperlinkPageExpression> element. RemoteAnchor The current hyperlink points to an anchor specified by the <hyperlinkAnchorExpression> element, within an external document indicated by the corresponding <hyperlinkReferenceExpression> element. RemotePage The current hyperlink points to a 1 based page index specified by the <hyperlinkPageExpression> element, within an external document indicated by the corresponding <hyperlinkReferenceExpression> element.
A custom (arbitrary) type.

attribute.name: hyperlinkTarget
attribute.description: Indicates the target of the hyperlink.

value.name: Self
value.description: Loads the hyperlink destination document into the window in which the link was clicked.

value.name: Blank
value.description: Loads the hyperlink destination document into a new blank window.

attribute.name: bookmarkLevel
attribute.description:
The level of the bookmark corresponding to the anchor.
The PDF exporter can create a bookmark tree using anchors defined in the report. This attributes specifies the level of the tree entry corresponding to this element's anchor. If set to "0" (the default), no bookmark will be created for the anchor.

attribute.name: customizerClass
attribute.description:
The name of the chart customizer class.
A chart can have an associated customizer class to perform customizations that are not directly supported by JRXML. The customizer class should implement net.sf.jasperreports.engine.JRChartCustomizer. At fill time, the customize() method of this class will be called before the chart is rendered.
If values of report parameters, variables or fields are needed in the customization, the customizer implementation should extend net.sf.jasperreports.engine.JRAbstractChartCustomizer to gain access to such values.

element.name: chartLegend
element.description: Specifies layout options for the legend of a chart.

attribute.name: textColor
attribute.description: The color of the text in the legend.

attribute.name: backgroundColor
attribute.description: The color of the background of the legend.

element.name: chartSubtitle
element.description: Subtitle of the chart

attribute.name: color
attribute.description: Color of the subtitle text

element.name: chartTitle
element.description: Title text of the chart

attribute.name: position
attribute.description: Position of the title

attribute.name: color
attribute.description: Color of the title text

element.name: closeExpression
element.description: Expression for the close value for <candlestickChart>

element.name: columnFooter
element.description: Definition of the column footer section for this report. The column footer is printed at the bottom of each column on the report. If the report's column count is 1, column header and footer sections are ignored.

element.name: columnHeader
element.description: Definition of the column header section for this report. The column header is printed at the beginning of each column on the report. If the report's column count is 1, column header and footer sections are ignored.

element.name: columnGroup
element.description:
Crosstab column group definition.
Each group in the crosstab has a variable that can be used inside the group header or inside the crosstab cells as the current group value. The variable has the same name as the group and the same type as the bucket expression of the group.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Group name.

attribute.name: height
attribute.description: The height of the column group header.

attribute.name: totalPosition
attribute.description:
The position of the total column for this group.
A group can have a total column summing the values for all the entries in the group. E.g. if there is a Year group having Month as a subgroup, the total column for the Year group would sum the values for all the years and the total column for the Month group would sum the values for all the months of an year.

value.name: Start
value.description: The total column will be displayed before the group column.

value.name: End
value.description: The total column will be displayed after the group column.

value.name: None
value.description: The total column will not be displayed.

attribute.name: headerPosition
attribute.description:
The position of the header contents on header span.
The column group headers stretch horizontally by spanning when there are multiple sub group entries. This attribute determines the way the header contents will be adjusted to the new width.

value.name: Left
value.description: The contents will be rendered on the left side of the header

value.name: Center
value.description: The contents will be rendered on the center of the header

value.name: Right
value.description: The contents will be rendered on the right side of the header

value.name: Stretch
value.description: The contents will be proportionally stretched to the new header width

element.name: comparatorExpression
element.description:
Crosstab group bucket comparator expression.
The result of this expression is used to sort the buckets, in ascending or descending order. If no comparator expression is specified, the natural order will be used.

element.name: conditionalStyle
element.description:
Used for adding conditions to a current style, to create dynamic styles.
Modifies the properties of the parent style, based on various conditions evaluated at fill time. It must be placed inside a top level style.

element.name: conditionExpression
element.description: A boolean expression which indicates if the style properties associated with it should be applied to the parent style.

element.name: connectionExpression
element.description: If present, it is used to pass the java.sql.Connection object to the subreport filling or subdataset iteration routines.

element.name: crosstab
element.description:
Crosstab definition.
To be noted that the crosstab will stretch downwards to fit the data but it will not exceed its report element width.
element.contains: ( reportElement, crosstabParameter*, parametersMapExpression?, crosstabDataset?, crosstabHeaderCell?, rowGroup*, columnGroup*, measure*, crosstabCell*, whenNoDataCell? )

attribute.name: isRepeatColumnHeaders
attribute.description: Flag that indicates whether the column headers will be reprinted after a page break.

value.name: true
value.description: The column headers will be reprinted after a page break.

value.name: false
value.description: The column headers will be printed only on the page where the crosstab starts.

attribute.name: isRepeatRowHeaders
attribute.description: Flag that indicates whether the row headers will be reprinted after a crosstab column break.

value.name: true
value.description: The row headers will be reprinted after a crosstab column break.

value.name: false
value.description: The column headers will be printed for all rows only for the first set of columns and not after a column break.

attribute.name: columnBreakOffset
attribute.description:
Offset used when a column break occurs and the filling is continued on the same page.
When the crosstab columns do not fit the width, the crosstab breaks the columns and prints the ones that don't fit after printing the first set of columns for all rows. This attribute is the offset to be used when continuing the printing after a column break.

attribute.name: runDirection
attribute.description:
The crosstab run direction.
Crosstabs can either be filled from left to right (the default) or from right to left (mainly for reports in RTL languages).
When a crosstab is filled from right to left, the crosstab contents will start from the right extremity of the crosstab element area and grow towards the left.

value.name: LTR
value.description: Left to right run direction.

value.name: RTL
value.description: Right to left run direction.

element.name: crosstabCell
element.description:
Crosstab data cell definition.
A crosstab can have multiple data cells for row/groups totals. Attributes rowTotalGroup and columnTotalGroup are used to specify that the cell corresponds to a total row/column.
E.g. if the crosstab has Country and City (subgroup of Country) row groups and Year and Month column groups, one can specify the following cells:
no rowTotalGroup and columnTotalGroup - the crosstab base cell (total for a city and a year)
columnTotalGroup="Month" - total for a city and a year
columnTotalGroup="Year" - total for a city and all years
rowTotalGroup="City" - total for all cities of a country and a month
rowTotalGroup="City" columnTotalGroup="Month" - total for all cities of a country and a year
rowTotalGroup="City" columnTotalGroup="Year" - total for all cities of a country and all years
rowTotalGroup="Country" - total for all countries and a month
rowTotalGroup="Country" columnTotalGroup="Month" - total for all countries and a year
rowTotalGroup="Country" columnTotalGroup="Year" - grand total
If the data cell for a total row/column is not specified, the cell will be inherited from lower level cells, if possible. For example, if the "total for all countries and a year" cell is not specified, the "total for a country and a year" or "total for a city and a year" cell will be used (in this order).
The data cell sizes are calculated from the base data cell sizes, i.e. the height of all data cells for a row will be the height of the base cell of that row. The base cell sizes are also inherited, e.g. if the height of a total row is not specified the height of the base row will be used.

attribute.name: width
attribute.description:
Crosstab cell width.
The width should be specified only for the base cell of a column (the one with no rowTotalGroup).

attribute.name: height
attribute.description:
Crosstab cell height.
The height should be specified only for the base cell of a row (the one with no columnTotalGroup).

attribute.name: rowTotalGroup
attribute.description: If this cell corresponds to a total row, this attribute should specify the name of the corresponding row group. The attribute should not be specified if the cell corresponds to a base (not total) row.

attribute.name: columnTotalGroup
attribute.description: If this cell corresponds to a total column, this attribute should specify the name of the corresponding column group. The attribute should not be specified if the cell corresponds to a base (not total) column.

element.name: crosstabColumnHeader
element.description:
Crosstab column header definition.
The size of the column header cell is computed based on the following rules:
the height of the header is given by the height attribute of <columnGroup>
the width of the last column group header is given by the width of the base cell
the width of a non-last column group header is the sum of the next group header's width and the next group total header's width (0 if the next group doesn't have a total header)

element.name: crosstabDataset
element.description: Crosstab dataset definition.

attribute.name: isDataPreSorted
attribute.description:
Flag that indicates whether the crosstab data is already sorted according to the row bucket expressions and group bucket expressions (in this order).
The crosstab calculation engine can optimize the calculations if the data is sorted by the row groups and column groups. For example, if there are two row groups R1 and R2 (subgroup of R1) and three column groups C1, C2 and C3 the data should be sorted by R1, R2, C1, C2, C3.

value.name: true
value.description: The calculation engine will assume that the data is presorted. If the data is not presorted, the outcome is undefined.

value.name: false
value.description: The crosstab dataset data is not presorted.

element.name: crosstabHeaderCell
element.description:
Crosstab cell that will be rendered at the upper-left corner of the crosstab.
The cell size will be calculated based on the row/column header cell widths/heights.

element.name: crosstabParameter
element.description: Crosstab parameter definition and value. Values from the report can only be accessed inside crosstab elements by passing them as parameters.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Name of the parameter.

attribute.name: class
attribute.description: Class of the parameter values.

element.name: crosstabRowHeader
element.description:
Crosstab row header definition.
The size of the row header cell is computed based on the following rules:
the width of the header is given by the width attribute of <rowGroup>
the height of the last row group header is given by the height of the base cell
the height of a non-last row group header is the sum of the next group header's height and the next group total header's height (0 if the next group doesn't have a total header)

element.name: crosstabTotalColumnHeader
element.description:
Crosstab total column header definition.
The size of a column group total header is computed based on the following rules:
the height is the sum the heights of this and subsequent column groups
the width is the width of the base cell for this total column
The total column is only printed if the totalPosition attribute of the group is different than None.

element.name: crosstabTotalRowHeader
element.description:
Crosstab total row header definition.
The size of a row group total header is computed based on the following rules:
the width is the sum the widths of this and subsequent row groups
the height is the height of the base cell for this total row
The total row is only printed if the totalPosition attribute of the group is different than None.

element.name: defaultValueExpression

element.contains: ( break | line | rectangle | ellipse | image | staticText | textField | subreport | pieChart | pie3DChart | barChart | bar3DChart | xyBarChart | stackedBarChart | stackedBar3DChart | lineChart | xyLineChart | areaChart | xyAreaChart | scatterChart | bubbleChart | timeSeriesChart | highLowChart | candlestickChart | meterChart | thermometerChart | multiAxisChart | stackedAreaChart | elementGroup | crosstab | frame )*

element.name: ellipse
element.description: Definition of an ellipse object.

element.name: field
element.description: Represents the definition of a data field that will store values retrieved from the data source of the report.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Name of the field.

attribute.name: class
attribute.description: Class of the field values.

element.name: fieldDescription
element.description: Can be used to specify a short text description for the field and is useful especially when creating special designed data sources and an extra information is needed in order to extract the value of the field.

element.name: filterExpression
element.description: Boolean expression used to filter the rows of a data source. This expression is used to filter the rows of the data source that this dataset will iterate on. This expression (if not null) is evaluated immediately after a new row is produced by the data source. The evaluation is performed using field and variable values corresponding to the new row. When the result of the evaluation is Boolean.TRUE the row gets processed by the report filling engine. When the result is null or Boolean.FALSE, the current row will be skipped and the datasource will be asked for the next row.

element.name: font
element.description: Defines the font to use with the text element.

attribute.name: reportFont
attribute.description: Name of the report level font to use as base font (see <reportFont> element).

attribute.name: fontName
attribute.description: Name of the font.

attribute.name: size
attribute.description: Size of the font.

attribute.name: pdfFontName
attribute.description: Name of the PDF font.

attribute.name: pdfEncoding
attribute.description: Encoding type to use with the PDF font.

attribute.name: isPdfEmbedded
attribute.description: Specifies if the PDF font should be embedded in the document.

element.name: frame
element.description:
A frame is a report element that contains sub elements. It has a backgroud, a border and it stretches to accommodate its content.
For the Graphics2D and PDF exporters, a frame is equivalent to a rectangle placed behind a group of elements. The HTML exporter creates sub-tables for frames and the XLS exporter includes the frame sub elements into the grid.
For elements inside a frame, the coordinates, positionType and stretchType properties and relative to the frame instead of the band.
element.contains: ( reportElement, box?, ( break | line | rectangle | ellipse | image | staticText | textField | subreport | pieChart | pie3DChart | barChart | bar3DChart | xyBarChart | stackedBarChart | stackedBar3DChart | lineChart | xyLineChart | areaChart | xyAreaChart | scatterChart | bubbleChart | timeSeriesChart | highLowChart | candlestickChart | meterChart | thermometerChart | multiAxisChart | stackedAreaChart | elementGroup | crosstab | frame )* )

attribute.name: isResetPageNumber

attribute.name: minHeightToStartNewPage

element.description: Used in hyperlink elements to generate a tooltip for the hyperlink. The type of the expression should be java.lang.String.

element.name: image
element.description: Definition of an image object.
element.contains: ( reportElement, box?, graphicElement?, imageExpression?, anchorNameExpression?, hyperlinkReferenceExpression?, hyperlinkAnchorExpression?, hyperlinkPageExpression?, hyperlinkTooltipExpression?, hyperlinkParameter* )

attribute.name: scaleImage
attribute.description: Image displaying type.

value.name: Clip
value.description: Only the portion of the image that fits the specified object width and height will be printed. Image is not stretched.

value.name: FillFrame
value.description: Image will be stretched to adapt to the specified object width and height.

value.name: RetainShape
value.description: Image will adapt to the specified object width or height keeping its original shape.

attribute.name: hAlign
attribute.description: Horizontal image alignment.

attribute.name: vAlign
attribute.description: Vertical image alignment.

attribute.name: isUsingCache
attribute.description: If true, tells the report engine to cache the images that are loaded from the same location.

attribute.name: isLazy
attribute.description: Gives control over when the images are retrieved from their specified location.

value.name: true
value.description: The image is loaded from the specified location only when the document is viewed or exported to other formats.

value.name: false
value.description: The image is loaded during the report filling process and stored in the resulting document.

attribute.name: onErrorType
attribute.description: Controls the behavior of the engine in case the image is not available.

value.name: Error
value.description: An exception is raised when loading the image.

value.name: Blank
value.description: The exception is ignored and the image displays as blank.

value.name: Icon
value.description: The exception is ignored and an image replacement icon is displayed.

attribute.name: evaluationTime
attribute.description: The image to be printed is supplied by the associated expression. This expression can be evaluated at a specified moment. This could be useful, for example, when we want to have on the first page a chart that will be generated only after fetching all the data source rows.

value.name: Now
value.description: The image expression is evaluated when filling the current band (section).

value.name: Report
value.description: The image expression is evaluated when reaching the end of the report.

value.name: Page
value.description: The image expression is evaluated when reaching the end of the current page.

value.name: Column
value.description: The image expression is evaluated when reaching the end of the current column.

value.name: Group
value.description: The image expression is evaluated when the group specified by the evaluationGroup attribute changes.

value.name: Band
value.description: The image expression is evaluated after the parent band has finished rendering all the other elements.

value.name: Auto
value.description:
Evaluation time used when report elements having expressions that combine values evaluated at different times are required (e.g. percentage out of a total).
Variables will be evaluated at a time corresponding to their reset type. Fields are evaluated "now", i.e. at the time the band the element lies on gets filled.
NB: avoid using this evaluation type when other types suffice as it can lead to performance loss.

attribute.name: evaluationGroup
attribute.description: Used to specify the group at which to evaluate the image expression value, when evaluationTime is "Group".

attribute.name: hyperlinkType
attribute.description:
Indicates the type of the hyperlink element.
The type can be:
One of the built-in types:
None The current element doesn't represent a hyperlink. Reference The current hyperlink points to an external resource specified by the corresponding <hyperlinkReferenceExpression> element, usually an URL. LocalAnchor The current hyperlink points to a local anchor specified by the corresponding <hyperlinkAnchorExpression> element. LocalPage The current hyperlink points to a 1 based page index within the current document specified by the corresponding <hyperlinkPageExpression> element. RemoteAnchor The current hyperlink points to an anchor specified by the <hyperlinkAnchorExpression> element, within an external document indicated by the corresponding <hyperlinkReferenceExpression> element. RemotePage The current hyperlink points to a 1 based page index specified by the <hyperlinkPageExpression> element, within an external document indicated by the corresponding <hyperlinkReferenceExpression> element.
A custom (arbitrary) type.

attribute.name: hyperlinkTarget
attribute.description: Indicates the target of the hyperlink.

value.name: Self
value.description: Loads the hyperlink destination document into the window in which the link was clicked.

value.name: Blank
value.description: Loads the hyperlink destination document into a new blank window.

attribute.name: bookmarkLevel
attribute.description:
The level of the bookmark corresponding to the anchor.
The PDF exporter can create a bookmark tree using anchors defined in the report. This attributes specifies the level of the tree entry corresponding to this element's anchor. If set to "0" (the default), no bookmark will be created for the anchor.

element.name: imageExpression
element.description: Definition of the expression that will be used to determine the image to be displayed.

attribute.name: class
attribute.description: Class of the image source.

value.name: java.lang.String
value.description: Image location. First, the report engine tries to see whether the String represents an URL. If not, it tries to find the file on disk and finally, if the String does not represent a path file, it searches in the CLASSPATH to find the image as a resource.

value.name: java.io.File
value.description: Image loaded by opening an java.io.InputStream from this java.io.File object.

value.name: java.net.URL
value.description: Image loaded by opening an java.io.InputStream from this java.net.URL object.

value.name: java.io.InputStream
value.description: Image loaded from an java.io.InputStream object.

value.name: java.awt.Image
value.description: Image loaded from a java.awt.Image object.

value.name: net.sf.jasperreports.engine.JRRenderable
value.description: The image will be drawn directly on the target graphic context by a serializable instance of this interface.

element.name: import
element.description: Translates into an import statement inside the expression class order to eliminate the need to use complete class names in the report expressions.

attribute.name: value
attribute.description: Class name or package to import.

element.name: incrementWhenExpression
element.description: Boolean expression that determines whether a chart or crosstab dataset will be incremented or not. The expression is evaluated before each increment of the dataset. The increment will be carried on only when the result of the evaluation is Boolean.TRUE; if the result is null or Boolean.FALSE, the dataset will not be incremented.

element.name: initialValueExpression
element.description: Definition of the expression that will be used to calculate the initial value of the variable, before any calculations are made.

element.name: itemHyperlink
element.description: Hyperlink specification for chart items. This hyperlink definition will be evaluated for every chart item and an image map will be created for the chart.

attribute.name: hyperlinkType
attribute.description:
Indicates the type of the hyperlink element.
The type can be:
One of the built-in types:
None The current element doesn't represent a hyperlink. Reference The current hyperlink points to an external resource specified by the corresponding <hyperlinkReferenceExpression> element, usually an URL. LocalAnchor The current hyperlink points to a local anchor specified by the corresponding <hyperlinkAnchorExpression> element. LocalPage The current hyperlink points to a 1 based page index within the current document specified by the corresponding <hyperlinkPageExpression> element. RemoteAnchor The current hyperlink points to an anchor specified by the <hyperlinkAnchorExpression> element, within an external document indicated by the corresponding <hyperlinkReferenceExpression> element. RemotePage The current hyperlink points to a 1 based page index specified by the <hyperlinkPageExpression> element, within an external document indicated by the corresponding <hyperlinkReferenceExpression> element.
A custom (arbitrary) type.

attribute.name: hyperlinkTarget
attribute.description: Indicates the target of the hyperlink.

value.name: Self
value.description: Loads the hyperlink destination document into the window in which the link was clicked.

value.name: Blank
value.description: Loads the hyperlink destination document into a new blank window.

element.name: jasperReport
element.description: Root element representing the definition of a report.
element.contains: ( property*, import*, reportFont*, style*, subDataset*, parameter*, queryString?, field*, sortField*, variable*, filterExpression?, group*, background?, title?, pageHeader?, columnHeader?, detail?, columnFooter?, pageFooter?, lastPageFooter?, summary?, noData? )

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Name of the report.

attribute.name: language
attribute.description: Specifies the language used for the report expressions.

attribute.name: columnCount
attribute.description: Number of columns on the report.

attribute.name: printOrder
attribute.description: Columns filling order.

value.name: Vertical
value.description: Columns on the report are filled vertically.

value.name: Horizontal
value.description: Columns on the report are filled horizontally.

attribute.name: pageWidth
attribute.description: Page width.

attribute.name: pageHeight
attribute.description: Page height.

attribute.name: orientation
attribute.description: Page printing orientation.

attribute.name: whenNoDataType
attribute.description: Allows users to customize the behavior of the reporting engine when there are now rows in the data source.

value.name: NoPages
value.description: The generated document contains zero pages.

value.name: BlankPage
value.description: The generated document contains one blank page.

value.name: AllSectionsNoDetail
value.description: All the report sections except the detail section will get printed.

value.name: NoDataSection
value.description: The generated document contains the noData section.

attribute.name: columnWidth
attribute.description: Column width.

attribute.name: columnSpacing
attribute.description: Space between columns.

attribute.name: leftMargin
attribute.description: Left margin.

attribute.name: rightMargin
attribute.description: Right margin.

attribute.name: topMargin
attribute.description: Top margin.

attribute.name: bottomMargin
attribute.description: Bottom margin.

attribute.name: isTitleNewPage
attribute.description: Flag used to specify if the title section should be printed on a separate initial page.

value.name: true
value.description: Title section will be printed on a separate initial page.

value.name: false
value.description: Title section will be printed on the first page of the report, along with the other sections.

attribute.name: isSummaryNewPage
attribute.description: Flag used to specify if the summary section should be printed on a separate last page.

value.name: true
value.description: Summary section will be printed on a separate last page.

value.name: false
value.description: Summary section will be printed on the last page of the report, along with the other sections, if there is enough space.

attribute.name: isFloatColumnFooter
attribute.description: Flag used to specify if the column footer section should be printed at the bottom of the column or if it should immediately follow the last detail or group footer printed on the current column.

value.name: true
value.description: The column footer section is printed immediately after the last detail or group footer printed on the current column.

value.name: false
value.description: The column footer section is printed at the bottom of the current column.

attribute.name: scriptletClass
attribute.description: Indicates which class implements the scriptlets functionality for this report. The specified class must be a subclass of JRAbstractScriptlet class. If omitted, an instance of JRDefaultScriptlet will be created.

attribute.name: resourceBundle
attribute.description: The base name of the report associated resource bundle.

attribute.name: whenResourceMissingType
attribute.description: Allows customizing the way the engine deals with missing resources in the resource bundle.

value.name: Null
value.description: Null is returned for the missing resource.

value.name: Empty
value.description: An empty string is returned for the missing resource.

value.name: Key
value.description: The key is returned for the missing resources.

value.name: Error
value.description: An exception is thrown when the resource with the specified key is missing.

attribute.name: isIgnorePagination
attribute.description:
Flag used to specify whether to use pagination.
This attribute can be overridden at fill time by the IS_IGNORE_PAGINATION parameter.

value.name: false
value.description: The report will be paginated according to the pageHeight attribute.

value.name: true
value.description: The report will be generated on one long page. The specified page heigt will still be used for report design.

attribute.name: formatFactoryClass
attribute.description: Specifies the name of the class implementing the net.sf.jasperreports.engine.util.FormatFactory interface to use with this report. If omitted, an instance of net.sf.jasperreports.engine.util.DefaultFormatFactory will be created.

element.name: keyExpression
element.description: Defines a key in a <pieDataset>

element.name: labelExpression
element.description: Defines a label in a <pieDataset>.

element.name: labelFont
element.description: Specifies the font to use when drawing the label of an axis in a chart. The label of an axis is the text that describes the axis.

element.name: lastPageFooter
element.description: The page footer section to use on the last page instead of the normal page footer. This might not be the very last page of the document in case the summary section is also present. This section is sometimes useful when summary information has to be displayed at the bottom of the last page.

element.name: line
element.description: Definition of a line object.

attribute.name: direction
attribute.description: Lines are drawn as diagonals of the rectangle defined by the report element properties. This attribute specifies which of the two diagonals should be drawn.

value.name: TopDown
value.description: The diagonal that starts in the top-left corner of the rectangle will be drawn.

value.name: BottomUp
value.description: The diagonal that starts in the bottom-left corner of the rectangle will be drawn.

element.name: lineChart
element.description: Defines a line chart

element.name: linePlot
element.description: Defines plot options for a <line chart>

attribute.name: isShowLines
attribute.description: Show lines flag

attribute.name: isShowShapes
attribute.description: Show shapes flag

element.name: lowExpression
element.description: Low expression in a <highLowChart>

element.name: lowRange
element.description: Defines the low range in a <thermometerChart>.

element.name: measure
element.description:
Crosstab measure definition.
A measure is a value accumulated by the crosstab calculation engine and displayed in the crosstab data cells.
Each measure in the crosstab has a variable that can be used inside the data cells as the current measure value. The variable has the same name and type as the measure.
Variables representing totals at different levels are also available. The names of these variables are:
<Measure>_<Row/Column Group>_ALL - the total for the column/row group
<Measure>_<Row Group>_<Column Group>_ALL - the combined total for the column and row groups
For instance, if one defines "Year" and "Month" column groups, a "City" row group and a "Sales" measure, then:
Sales_Month_ALL will hold the total for all months (i.e. for one year)
Sales_City_Month_ALL will hold the total for all months (one year) and all cities
Sales_City_Year_ALL will hold the grand total

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Measure name.

attribute.name: class
attribute.description: The measure values class.

attribute.name: calculation
attribute.description: The calculation type to be performed on the measure values.

value.name: Nothing
value.description: No calculations are performed.

value.name: Count
value.description: The measure stores the number of the not null values.

value.name: DistinctCount
value.description: The measure stores the number of distinct not null values.

value.name: Sum
value.description: The measure stores the sum of the not null values. Numeric measures only.

value.name: Average
value.description: The measure stores the average of the not null values. Numeric measures only.

value.name: Lowest
value.description: The measure stores the lowest value.

value.name: Highest
value.description: The measure stores the highest value.

value.name: StandardDeviation
value.description: The measure stores the standard deviation of the not null values. Numeric measures only.

value.name: Variance
value.description: The measure stores the variance of the not null values. Numeric measures only.

value.name: First
value.description: The measure stores the first value encountered and ignores subsequent values.

attribute.name: incrementerFactoryClass
attribute.description: The name of a class that implements the net.sf.jasperreports.engine.fill.JRIncrementerFactory interface to use when creating the incrementer instance for this measure. Incrementers are objects that implement the net.sf.jasperreports.engine.fill.JRIncrementer interface and handle the incremental calculation performed on the measure's current value with every entry in the crosstab dataset.

attribute.name: percentageOf
attribute.description:
The percentage calculation type performed on this measure.
If percentage calculation is required, the value class should be one of the built-in supported percentage types or the percentage calculator class should be specified. The classes with built-in support are java.lang.Float, java.lang.Double, java.lang.Byte, java.lang.Short, java.lang.Integer, java.lang.Long, java.math.BigDecimal and java.math.BigInteger.

value.name: None
value.description: The value will not be calculated as a percentage

value.name: GrandTotal
value.description: The value will be calculated as percentage of the grand total value

attribute.name: percentageCalculatorClass
attribute.description:
The percentage calcualtor class name.
The class should implement the net.sf.jasperreports.crosstabs.fill.JRPercentageCalculator interface.

element.name: measureExpression
element.description: Crosstab measure expression.

element.name: mediumRange
element.description: Defines the medium range in a <thermometerChart>.

element.name: meterChart
element.description: Defines a meter chart. A meter chart plots a single value on a dial. In addition to the value being plotted multiple ranges can be specified to help interpret the value.

element.name: meterInterval
element.description: Describes a range of a meterChart to highlight. A typical use is to divide a meter up into sections such as "normal", "warning" and "critical" and color code them.

attribute.name: label
attribute.description: The name of this region. The name will appear in the meter's legend if the legend is being displayed.

attribute.name: color
attribute.description: The color used to shade the region in the meter. If not set the region will have no visual indicator.

attribute.name: alpha
attribute.description: The alpha (transparency) of the shading for the region. The values range from 0.0 (completely transparent) to 1.0 (completely opaque).

element.name: meterPlot
element.description: Plot options for a meterChart.

attribute.name: shape
attribute.description:
Defines the shape of the meter. The final appearance is determined by the combination of this attribute and the angle attribute. This attribute only matters when the meter is using an angle over 180 degrees.
When a meter is over 180 degrees wide the space between the start and end of the meter can be filled in several different ways. The best way to visualize this is to think of a twelve hour clock. If the angle of the meter is 240 degrees the meter will start at 8, sweep up past 12 and down to 4. This attribute specifies how to fill the area between 4 o'clock and 8 o'clock.

value.name: chord
value.description: A straight line is drawn between the start point and the end point, and the area bounded by the meter and this line is shaded with the background color.

value.name: circle
value.description: The unused portion of the circle that describes the meter is shaded with the background color.

value.name: pie
value.description: The unused portion of the circle that describes the meter is not shaded at all.

attribute.name: angle
attribute.description: The extent of the meter in degrees. Use 180 for a semicircle.

attribute.name: units
attribute.description: An optional string that describes the unit that the meter is displaying. This string will be appended to the value.

attribute.name: tickInterval
attribute.description: The amount of space between values to mark as "ticks" on the face of the meter. If the meter has a data range of 0-100 and the tick interval is 20, there will be 4 ticks at 20, 40, 60 and 80.

attribute.name: meterColor
attribute.description: The color of meter. If meterIntervals are defined they may mask this color.

attribute.name: needleColor
attribute.description: The color used to draw the needle in the meter.

attribute.name: tickColor
attribute.description: The color of the meter ticks, if any.

element.name: multiAxisChart
element.description:
Definition of chart with multiple range axis, all sharing a common domain axis. The domain is determined by the dataset of each nested report, and they must all use the same type of dataset. The time period datasets (highLowDataset, candlestickDataset and timeSeriesDataset) are considered the same and can be mixed.
Each nested chart has its own range, so you can combine charts with significantly different scales. Each chart will have its own axis showing its range, and it is highly recommended to color the data series and the axis to match.
The plot options of the nested reports are ignored - the plot is configured via the multiAxisPlot. The only exception to this is any seriesColors specified in the plot of a nested report, which will be used to color a specific series in that report. In this case the seriesOrder in the seriesColor is an absolute specification of a series to color, not a relative ordering.

element.name: multiAxisPlot
element.description: Plot options for a <multiAxisChart>. The set plot options will be shared by all the charts inside this plot, and the nested charts are specified via the <axis> tags. All nested charts must share the same type of domain axis - a category, a numeric (xy) or a time based axis.

element.name: noData
element.description: Definition of the noData section for this report. The noData section is printed only if whenNoDataType attribute is set to "NoDataSection".

element.name: openExpression
element.description: Open expression for a <candlestickChart>

element.name: pageFooter
element.description: Definition of the page footer section for this report. The page footer is printed at the bottom of each page on the report.

element.name: pageHeader
element.description: Definition of the page header section for this report. The page header is printed at the beginning of each page on the report.

element.name: parameter
element.description: Represents the definition of a report parameter. Parameters are very useful for passing data to the report engine and can be used in the expressions or in the query string of the report.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Name of the parameter.

attribute.name: class
attribute.description: Class of the parameter values.

attribute.name: isForPrompting
attribute.description: Optional flag that might be used by the parent application to prompt the user for the parameter value.

element.name: parameterDescription
element.description: Can be used to specify a short text description for the parameter and is useful especially when prompting for the user to supply a value for this parameter at runtime.

element.name: parameterValueExpression
element.description: Crosstab parameter value expression.

element.name: parametersMapExpression
element.description: Allows bulk passing the parameters to the subreport/subdataset into a java.lang.Map object. There are cases when we want to pass to the subreport/subdataset the same parameters that the master report has received. This can be achieved by passing the system-defined parameter called REPORT_PARAMETERS_MAP and maybe adding to or overriding those parameters using additional <subreportParameter> elements.

element.name: pie3DChart
element.description: Defines a pie chart with 3D effect

element.name: pie3DPlot
element.description: Defines plot options for a <pie3DChart>

attribute.name: depthFactor
attribute.description: Depth factor for a pie chart plot

attribute.name: isCircular
attribute.description: Indicates whether the pie chart is circular, or stretched into an elliptical shape

element.name: pieChart
element.description: Defines a pie type chart

element.name: pieDataset
element.description: Defines a dataset to be used with <pieChart>

element.name: piePlot
element.description: Plot options for a <pieChart>

attribute.name: isCircular
attribute.description: Indicates whether the pie chart is circular, or stretched into an elliptical shape

element.name: plot
element.description: Defines generic plot options for charts

attribute.name: backcolor
attribute.description: Background color of the chart

attribute.name: orientation
attribute.description: Orientation of the chart

attribute.name: backgroundAlpha
attribute.description: Alpha (transparency) parameter for the background

attribute.name: foregroundAlpha
attribute.description: Alpha (transparency) parameter for the foreground

attribute.name: labelRotation
attribute.description: Degrees to rotate the text labels for the x axis of the chart. Positive values rotate the text clockwise and negative values rotate it counterclockwise. This attribute has no effect on charts where the x axis is either numeric or a date.

element.name: printWhenExpression
element.description: Definition of a Boolean expression that will determine if the element or the band should be printed or not.

element.name: property
element.description: Allows the creation of a name-value pair property for a report object (e.g. the report itself, a field, a parameter, etc).

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Name of the object property.

attribute.name: value
attribute.description: Value of the object property.

element.name: queryString
element.description: Contains the SQL query that will be used to retrieve the data needed to fill the report.

attribute.name: language
attribute.description:
Specifies the query language.
Based on the query language, a corresponding net.sf.jasperreports.engine.query.JRQueryExecuterFactory is used to create net.sf.jasperreports.engine.query.JRQueryExecuter instance. The query executer is responsible for executing the query and creating a JRDataSource from the result.
A executer for a query language is registered using a JR propery named net.sf.jasperreports.query.executer.factory.<language>

element.name: rectangle
element.description: Definition of a rectangle object.

attribute.name: radius
attribute.description: The radius of the arc corner.

element.name: reportElement
element.description: Element used to specify the common properties of an object on the report.

attribute.name: key
attribute.description: This attribute is used to identify band elements by their "key" when wanting to alter their settings at runtime. The key value must be unique for elements within report band.

attribute.name: style
attribute.description: Name of the report level style to use as base style (see <style> element).

attribute.name: positionType
attribute.description: Specifies the object position when the report section is affected by stretch.

value.name: Float
value.description: The element moves relative to the size of the surrounding elements.

value.name: FixRelativeToTop
value.description: The element maintains its position relative to the top of the band.

value.name: FixRelativeToBottom
value.description: The element maintains its position relative to the bottom of the band.

attribute.name: stretchType
attribute.description: Specifies the graphic element stretch behavior when the report section is affected by stretch.

value.name: NoStretch
value.description: The graphic element won't stretch vertically as the band stretches to display field data.

value.name: RelativeToTallestObject
value.description: The graphic element will stretch to accommodate the tallest object in its the group. See the <elementGroup> element, to see how to group elements in bands.

value.name: RelativeToBandHeight
value.description: The graphic element will stretch to fit in the band.

attribute.name: isPrintRepeatedValues
attribute.description: This flag allows suppressing the repeating values for the dynamic elements such as text fields and image fields and to fully customize the behavior of the static elements like rectangles, lines, ellipses and static texts.

value.name: true
value.description: Dynamic elements will print even if their values repeat. Static elements will appear every time the band that contains them is started.

value.name: false
value.description: Suppresses the repeated values for the dynamic elements. The static elements will print only according to the other 3 attributes: isPrintInFirstWholeBand, isPrintWhenDetailOverflows, printWhenGroupChanges.

attribute.name: mode
attribute.description: Specifies whether the background of an object is transparent or opaque.

attribute.name: x
attribute.description: Specifies the x coordinate for the object within the band.

attribute.name: y
attribute.description: Specifies the y coordinate for the object within the band.

attribute.name: width
attribute.description: Width of the object.

attribute.name: height
attribute.description: Height of the object.

attribute.name: isRemoveLineWhenBlank
attribute.description: Collapses the band if the element is not printing and no other element is occupying the same horizontal space.

attribute.name: isPrintInFirstWholeBand
attribute.description: The element gets printed in the first band of a new page or column that is not an overflow from a previous page or column.

attribute.name: isPrintWhenDetailOverflows
attribute.description: The element will be printed when the band overflows to a new page or a new column.

attribute.name: printWhenGroupChanges
attribute.description: The element will be printed when the specified group changes.

attribute.name: forecolor
attribute.description: Fore color to use when drawing the object. Hexadecimal formatted values preceded by the # character or decimal values are accepted along with the following predefined color values: black, blue, cyan, darkGray, gray, green, lightGray, magenta, orange, pink, red, yellow, white.

attribute.name: backcolor
attribute.description: Back color to use when drawing the object. Hexadecimal formatted values preceded by the # character or decimal values are accepted along with the following predefined color values: black, blue, cyan, darkGray, gray, green, lightGray, magenta, orange, pink, red, yellow, white.

element.name: reportFont
element.description: Represents the definition of a report font. Report fonts are used as default or base font settings in other font definitions throughout the report.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Name of the report font definition.

attribute.name: isDefault
attribute.description: The default report font is used as base font for all the font definitions that do not explicitly reference a report font definition.

attribute.name: fontName
attribute.description: Name of the font.

attribute.name: size
attribute.description: Size of the font.

attribute.name: pdfFontName
attribute.description: Name of the PDF font.

attribute.name: pdfEncoding
attribute.description: Encoding type to use with the PDF font.

attribute.name: isPdfEmbedded
attribute.description: Specifies if the PDF font should be embedded in the document.

element.name: rowGroup
element.description:
Crosstab row group definition.
Each group in the crosstab has a variable that can be used inside the group header or inside the crosstab cells as the current group value. The variable has the same name as the group and the same type as the bucket expression of the group.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Group name.

attribute.name: width
attribute.description: The width of the row group header.

attribute.name: totalPosition
attribute.description:
The position of the total row for this group.
A group can have a total row summing the values for all the entries in the group. E.g. if there is a Year group having Month as a subgroup, the total row for the Year group would sum the values for all the years and the total row for the Month group would sum the values for all the months of an year.

value.name: Start
value.description: The total row will be displayed before the group rows.

value.name: End
value.description: The total row will be displayed after the group rows.

value.name: None
value.description: The total row will not be displayed.

attribute.name: headerPosition
attribute.description:
The position of the header contents on header span.
The row group headers stretch vertically by spanning when there are multiple sub group entries. This attribute determines the way the header contents will be adjusted to the new height.

value.name: Top
value.description: The contents will be rendered at the top of the header

value.name: Middle
value.description: The contents will be rendered on the center of the header

value.name: Bottom
value.description: The contents will be rendered at the bottom of the header

value.name: Stretch
value.description: The contents will be proportionally stretched to the new header height

value.name: Count
value.description: Variable stores the number of the not null values returned from the subreport.

value.name: DistinctCount
value.description: Variable stores the number of distinct not null values returned from the subreport.

value.name: Sum
value.description: Variable stores the sum of the not null values returned from the subreport. Numeric variables only.

value.name: Average
value.description: Variable stores the average of the not null values returned from the subreport. Numeric variables only.

value.name: Lowest
value.description: Variable stores the lowest value returned from the subreport.

value.name: Highest
value.description: Variable stores the highest value returned from the subreport.

value.name: StandardDeviation
value.description: Variable stores the standard deviation of the not null values returned from the subreport. Numeric variables only.

value.name: Variance
value.description: Variable stores the variance of the not null values returned from the subreport. Numeric variables only.

value.name: First
value.description: Variable stores the first value encountered and ignores subsequent values.

attribute.name: hyperlinkType
attribute.description:
Indicates the type of the hyperlink element.
The type can be:
One of the built-in types:
None The current element doesn't represent a hyperlink. Reference The current hyperlink points to an external resource specified by the corresponding <hyperlinkReferenceExpression> element, usually an URL. LocalAnchor The current hyperlink points to a local anchor specified by the corresponding <hyperlinkAnchorExpression> element. LocalPage The current hyperlink points to a 1 based page index within the current document specified by the corresponding <hyperlinkPageExpression> element. RemoteAnchor The current hyperlink points to an anchor specified by the <hyperlinkAnchorExpression> element, within an external document indicated by the corresponding <hyperlinkReferenceExpression> element. RemotePage The current hyperlink points to a 1 based page index specified by the <hyperlinkPageExpression> element, within an external document indicated by the corresponding <hyperlinkReferenceExpression> element.
A custom (arbitrary) type.

attribute.name: hyperlinkTarget
attribute.description: Indicates the target of the hyperlink.

value.name: Self
value.description: Loads the hyperlink destination document into the window in which the link was clicked.

value.name: Blank
value.description: Loads the hyperlink destination document into a new blank window.

element.name: seriesColor
element.description:
Defines the color to use for a series in the report. If only one seriesColor is specified it becomes the color of the first series. If more than one seriesColor is specified the chart will cycle through the supplied colors. Meter and Thermometer charts do not have series and will ignore any seriesColor settings.
When used in a chart that part of a multi-axis chart series color is treated a bit differently. The default color series to cycle through is defined in the plot of the multi axis chart, and the color series for the nested charts define series colors for that chart only. This is useful when a multiple axis chart contains several line charts, each with one series. By default every line will be the first in its plot and will have the first color defined in the multi axis plot, so every line will be the same color. To solve this you can set a seriesColor for each nested chart to override the default colors.

attribute.name: seriesOrder
attribute.description:
The relative order of this color. All seriesColors are sorted by the value of this attribute, and appear in that order when coloring the series.
When the chart is nested inside a multiple axis chart the seriesOrder is the actual series number to apply the color to. Series use zero-based indexing.

attribute.name: color
attribute.description: The color to use for the series

element.name: seriesExpression
element.description: Defines a series expression in a dataset

element.description: Introduces a field to use for sorting the data source.

attribute.name: order

element.contains: ( property*, parameter*, queryString?, field*, sortField*, variable*, filterExpression?, group* )

attribute.description: Indicates which class implements the scriptlets functionality for this dataset. The specified class must be a subclass of JRAbstractScriptlet class. If omitted, an instance of JRDefaultScriptlet will be created.

attribute.name: resourceBundle

attribute.name: whenResourceMissingType
attribute.description: Allows customizing the way the engine deals with missing resources in the resource bundle.

value.name: Null
value.description: Null is returned for the missing resource.

value.name: Empty
value.description: An empty string is returned for the missing resource.

value.name: Key
value.description: The key is returned for the missing resources.

value.name: Error
value.description: An exception is thrown when the resource with the specified key is missing.

attribute.name: isUsingCache
attribute.description: If true, tells the report engine to cache the report definition objects that are loaded from the same location.

attribute.name: class

value.name: java.lang.String
value.description: Subreport location. First, the report engine tries to see whether the String represents an URL. If not, it tries to find the file on disk and finally, if the String does not represent a path file, it searches in the CLASSPATH to find the report definition as a resource.

value.name: java.io.File
value.description: Subreport loaded by opening an java.io.InputStream from this java.io.File object.

value.name: java.net.URL
value.description: Subreport loaded by opening an java.io.InputStream from this java.net.URL object.

value.name: java.io.InputStream

attribute.description: Type of alignment for the text object.

value.name: Left
value.description: Text is aligned to the left.

value.name: Center
value.description: Text is centered.

value.name: Right

value.name: Justified

attribute.description: Type of rotation for the text object.

value.name: None
value.description: Text runs horizontally from left to right and from top to bottom.

value.name: Left

value.name: Right

value.name: UpsideDown

attribute.name: lineSpacing
attribute.description: Type of line spacing for the text object.

value.name: Single
value.description: Normal line spacing
Medium line spacing.

value.name: Double

attribute.name: isStyledText
attribute.description: When set to true, this attribute signals to the rendering engine that the text element contains preformatted text. Style information can be introduced in the text content using nested <style> tags that support the folowing attributes : fontName, size, isBold, isItalic, isUnderline, isStrikeThrough, pdfFontName, pdfEncoding, isPdfEmbedded, forecolor, backcolor.

value.name: true
value.description: The text element contains text formatted using nested <style> tags.

value.name: false
value.description: The text element has a pure text content, without style information.

element.name: textField
element.description: Definition of a text field object.
element.contains: ( reportElement, box?, textElement?, textFieldExpression?, anchorNameExpression?, hyperlinkReferenceExpression?, hyperlinkAnchorExpression?, hyperlinkPageExpression?, hyperlinkTooltipExpression?, hyperlinkParameter* )

attribute.name: isStretchWithOverflow
attribute.description: Instructs the report engine to allow the text field to stretch downwards in order to display all its text when it doesn't fit in the defined text field height.

attribute.name: evaluationTime
attribute.description: Text to be printed is supplied by the text field associated expression. This expression can be evaluated at a specified moment. This could be useful, for example, when we want to have on the first page the total number of pages. The total number of pages is known only after filling the entire report, so we can specify that the text filed that will represent the total number of pages placed at the beginning of the report should be evaluated only when reaching the end of the report.

value.name: Now
value.description: Text field expression is evaluated when filling the current band (section).

value.name: Report
value.description: Text field expression is evaluated when reaching the end of the report.

value.name: Page
value.description: Text field expression is evaluated when reaching the end of the current page.

value.name: Column
value.description: Text field expression is evaluated when reaching the end of the current column.

value.name: Group
value.description: Text field expression is evaluated when the group specified by the evaluationGroup attribute changes.

value.name: Band
value.description: Text field expression is evaluated after the parent band has finished rendering all the other elements.

value.name: Auto
value.description:
Evaluation time used when report elements having expressions that combine values evaluated at different times are required (e.g. percentage out of a total).
Variables will be evaluated at a time corresponding to their reset type. Fields are evaluated "now", i.e. at the time the band the element lies on gets filled.
NB: avoid using this evaluation type when other types suffice as it can lead to performance loss.

attribute.name: evaluationGroup
attribute.description: Used to specify the group at which to evaluate the text field value, when evaluationTime is "Group".

attribute.name: pattern
attribute.description: Pattern to use when formatting the output of the text field expression.

attribute.name: isBlankWhenNull
attribute.description: Specifies that the text field should display a blank character instead of "null" when the text field expression evaluates to null.

attribute.description:

None The current element doesn't represent a hyperlink. Reference The current hyperlink points to an external resource specified by the corresponding <hyperlinkReferenceExpression> element, usually an URL. LocalAnchor The current hyperlink points to a local anchor specified by the corresponding <hyperlinkAnchorExpression> element. LocalPage The current hyperlink points to a 1 based page index within the current document specified by the corresponding <hyperlinkPageExpression> element. RemoteAnchor The current hyperlink points to an anchor specified by the <hyperlinkAnchorExpression> element, within an external document indicated by the corresponding <hyperlinkReferenceExpression> element. RemotePage The current hyperlink points to a 1 based page index specified by the <hyperlinkPageExpression> element, within an external document indicated by the corresponding <hyperlinkReferenceExpression> element.
A custom (arbitrary) type.

attribute.description:
The level of the bookmark corresponding to the anchor.
The PDF exporter can create a bookmark tree using anchors defined in the report. This attributes specifies the level of the tree entry corresponding to this element's anchor. If set to "0" (the default), no bookmark will be created for the anchor.

element.name: variable
element.description: Represents the definition of a report variable. Variables are objects that store the values of their associated expressions or perform various calculations on those expression values. Expressions are java expressions build on top of fields and variables declared in the report. They are evaluated at runtime, when filling the report.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: Name of the variable.

attribute.name: class
attribute.description: Class of the variable values.

attribute.name: resetType
attribute.description: Reset level for variables that perform calculations.

value.name: None
value.description: Variable is never initialized using the initial value expression and only holds the values obtained by evaluating its main expression.

value.name: Report
value.description: Variable is initialized only once, at the beginning of the report.

value.name: Page
value.description: Variable is initialized at the beginning of each page.

value.name: Column
value.description: Variable is initialized at the beginning of each column.

value.name: Group
value.description: Variable is initialized when the group specified by the resetGroup attribute changes.

attribute.name: resetGroup
attribute.description: Name of the group at which the variable is reinitialized, when resetType is "Group".

attribute.name: incrementType
attribute.description: Increment level for variables that perform calculations.

value.name: None
value.description: Variable is incremented with every record in the data source.

value.name: Report
value.description: Variable is incremented only once, at the end of the report.

value.name: Page
value.description: Variable is incremented at the end of each page.

value.name: Column
value.description: Variable is incremented at the end of each column.

value.name: Group
value.description: Variable is incremented when the group specified by the incrementGroup attribute changes.

attribute.name: incrementGroup
attribute.description: Name of the group at which the variable is incremented, when incrementType is "Group".

attribute.name: calculation
attribute.description: Calculation to perform on the variable expression when filling the report.

value.name: Nothing
value.description: No calculations are performed.

value.name: Count
value.description: Variable stores the number of the not null values encountered for the variable expression.

value.name: DistinctCount
value.description: Variable stores the number of distinct not null values encountered for the variable expression.

value.name: Sum
value.description: Variable stores the sum of the not null values encountered for the variable expression. Numeric variables only.

value.name: Average
value.description: Variable stores the average of the not null values encountered for the variable expression. Numeric variables only.

value.name: Lowest
value.description: Variable stores the lowest value encountered for the variable expression.

value.name: Highest
value.description: Variable stores the highest value encountered for the variable expression.

value.name: StandardDeviation
value.description: Variable stores the standard deviation of the not null values encountered for the variable expression. Numeric variables only.

value.name: Variance
value.description: Variable stores the variance of the not null values encountered for the variable expression. Numeric variables only.

value.name: System
value.description: Variable stores a system (custom) calculated value.

value.name: First
value.description: Variable stores the first value encountered and ignores subsequent values.

attribute.name: incrementerFactoryClass
attribute.description: The name of a class that implements the net.sf.jasperreports.engine.fill.JRIncrementerFactory interface to use when creating the incrementer instance for this variable. Incrementers are objects that implement the net.sf.jasperreports.engine.fill.JRIncrementer interface and handle the incremental calculation performed on the variable's current value with every iteration in the data source.

element.name: variableExpression
element.description: Definition of the expression associated with the variable. The value of this expression will be calculated at runtime and will represent the value of the corresponding variable or it will be used in calculation to obtain the value of the calculated variable.
